perturbation.original_text: 3. To the extent, if any, that provision of this Agreement conflicts with or differs from any provision of the Agreement, such provision of this Second Amendment shall prevail and govern for all purposes and in all respects.
perturbation.changed_text: 3. To the extent, if any, that provision of this Agreement conflicts with or differs from any provision of the Agreement, such provision of the original Co-Branding Agreement shall prevail and govern for all purposes and in all respects. This is intended to ensure consistency with the initial intentions of both parties.
perturbation.explanation: This change directly contradicts the original intent of Section 3, which states that the Second Amendment prevails in case of conflict. Now, it states the opposite, that the original agreement prevails, creating a significant contradiction about which document has precedence.

perturbation.original_text: 4. Except as modified hereby, the Agreement and its terms and provisions are hereby ratified and confirmed for all purposes and in all respects.
perturbation.changed_text: 4. Except as explicitly rejected hereby, the Agreement and its terms and provisions are only considered suggestive and not binding.
perturbation.explanation: The original section clearly states that the Agreement is ratified, confirming its validity. The changed text says the agreement is only suggestive and not binding. This directly contradicts the concept of ratification and the legal force of the original agreement.

perturbation.original_text: WHEREAS, the parties hereto desire to further amend the Agreement to modify the provisions of the Agreement regarding [***] of the term thereof; and
perturbation.changed_text: WHEREAS, the parties hereto desire to not amend the Agreement regarding [***] of the term thereof; and
perturbation.explanation: The original text states the desire to amend, while the modified text states the desire *not* to amend. This creates a direct contradiction in the stated intention of the parties entering into the amendment, undermining the purpose of the document.
